page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: We wanted to look at the different forms of transport in our district. Motor cars are the chief form of transport within the U.K..70 m.p.h. is the fastest speed permitted. We did a traffic count on a nice sunny day at 2.15 p.m.on July 9th 1985, near to the traffic lights on the A38. We counted for ten minutes. Counting in both directions there were 67 cars, 3 moter cycles, 0 coaches or buses 11 lories and 7 vans, totalling 88 vehicles. Most of the lorries were transporting building materials, including stone from the local quarries. We surveyed all 11 year old children in our district attending Avon primary schools to discover the number of cars in each household. 1 household had 5 cars and 2 had 4 cars. 4 households had 3 cars. 26 households had 2 cars and 5 had 1 car.
